key_channel_insights.line_content: Website fares are absent on OTAs for one-in-five itineraries (20.7%) and gaps are widening fastest on long-haul and close-in searches.
MSE prices remain lower than web on 76% of checks despite a 15-ppt week-on-week improvement; average gap −5%.
98%+ of itineraries price higher in GDS, though the average uplift is only 0.36%, signalling broad but shallow mark-ups.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Website fares are missing on OTAs for 20.7% of itineraries, up 4 ppts WoW and 3 ppts MoM—visibility is slipping fastest on long-haul and close-in searches.
Exact fare matching still covers 76.6% of itineraries but fell 2.5 ppts WoW, driven by short-haul and non-GR markets.
OTA-lower cases collapsed to 0.2% of records; remaining variance is minor mark-ups averaging +0.21%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: At 20.7% frequency, OTA N/A is the largest exception and rose 4.2 ppts WoW—eroding distribution reach.
Parity dominates (76.6%) but is trending downward; vigilance needed to prevent further drift below the 80% benchmark.
Undercut share is negligible at 0.22%, reducing revenue-dilution risk.
Premium cases at 2.44% show only a 0.21% uplift—unlikely to deter demand but worth monitoring.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 22.8% of short-haul itineraries are absent and parity dropped to 74.5%, driving most of the overall decline.
Parity strong at 91.7%, yet ‘not found’ rate jumped to 6.1% (+4.4 ppts WoW); early corrective action advised.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 81.3% parity and only 16% absence keep the home market tight.
Outside Greece, 35.7% of itineraries are missing and parity falls to 62.3%—urgent focus area.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Last-minute searches show 23.9% absence and lowest parity (73.7%), threatening high-yield demand.
>14-day window enjoys 82.9% parity and 14.2% absence, setting the performance bar.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE lower-than-web share fell 15 ppts WoW to 76%, marking first notable parity gain.
Exact-match share climbed to 23%, reflecting early success of pricing controls.
Long-haul and non-Greek origins still see MSE undercutting in ~97% of cases; targeted fixes required.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE N/A at only 0.16%; no distribution gap detected.
Parity grew 15 ppts WoW to 23%, improving customer price confidence.
Still 76% of flows at −5% vs web; closing this gap remains top priority.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Undercut share down 17 ppts to 73%, delta −5%; further tightening needed.
97% of long-haul ODs cheaper on MSE; parity gains negligible.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Lower-price incidence dropped 20 ppts to 70%, best network-wide gain.
96% of itineraries still undercut; contractual review advised.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Undercut at 78% (-14 ppts WoW) with stable −5% gap; tactical web adjustments helping.
Improvement strongest: undercut share down 17 ppts to 72%, yet parity still below 28% goal.

gds_highlights.line_content: 98.4% of itineraries price higher in GDS; average mark-up a shallow 0.36%.
GDS N/A fell to 1.4% of ODs, a 0.56-ppt MoM gain.
True price parity effectively 0%, highlighting structural mis-alignment.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Premium share stable at 98.4% with 0.36% average uplift—high frequency, low depth.
Only 1.4% of ODs lack offers, down 0.56 ppt MoM.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 98.3% higher with 0.37% uplift; incidence edged down 0.08 ppt WoW.
99.1% higher, but lower uplift at 0.28%; incidence up 0.44 ppt WoW.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 99.1% higher with a slimmer 0.20% premium, showing tighter control abroad.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 100% higher with 0.40% premium; coverage now complete after 1.28-ppt MoM gain.
